The network offers a variety of professional development opportunities to science teachers, such as workshops, conferences, and leadership training. It also provides resources and tools to enhance science education, such as lesson plans and curriculum materials. In addition, LASTN organizes events that bring science educators together to share ideas and best practices. One of the main objectives of LASTN is to improve science education in the region. It partners with local universities and research institutions to connect teachers with scientists and industry professionals. This partnership helps to bridge the gap between scientific research and classroom instruction, making science education more relevant and engaging for students. LASTN has been recognized for its contributions to science education by receiving awards from the National Science Teachers Association and the California Science Teachers Association. The organization has been instrumental in the development of the Next Generation Science Standards in California. In conclusion, the Los Angeles Science Teachers Network is a valuable resource for science teachers in the region. Its programs and activities contribute to the professional growth of science educators, enhance science education, and strengthen the community of science teachers in the Los Angeles area.

The Count of Lucena is a noble title in Spain, which was granted to Don Rodrigo Ponce de León in 1573 by King Philip II. The title is named after the town of Lucena, which is located in the province of Córdoba, Andalusia. The first Count of Lucena, Don Rodrigo Ponce de León, belonged to one of the most powerful families in Spain, the House of Ponce de León. Throughout history, many distinguished members of the Ponce de León family have held the title of Count of Lucena, including the famous Spanish poet Luis de Góngora, who was the 8th Count of Lucena. The title has remained in the family for over 400 years and has been passed down from generation to generation. The Counts of Lucena have been known for their contributions to Spanish culture and society. Luis de Góngora, for example, was a prominent figure in the Spanish literary movement known as the Baroque. He was known for his elaborate and ornate writing style and is considered one of the most important poets in Spanish history. The current holder of the title of Count of Lucena is Don Luis María Fernández de Córdoba y Ponce de León, who succeeded his father in 2018. Don Luis María is a historian and a member of the Spanish Academy of History. He is also actively involved in promoting traditional Spanish culture and has written several books on Spanish history and culture. In conclusion, the title of Count of Lucena is an important part of Spanish history and culture. The Ponce de León family has played a significant role in shaping Spanish society and their legacy continues to be celebrated to this day.

Thorsten Teichert is a German-born entrepreneur and investor who is best known for his contributions to the fintech industry. He has founded and co-founded several successful startups that have revolutionized the world of finance and technology. Teichert was born in Germany in 1974. He obtained his degree in Business Administration from the University of Bayreuth in 1999 and went on to work for several years in the banking industry. In 2002, he founded his first startup, MyHammer AG, which went on to become Europe's largest online marketplace for craftsmen and service providers. After the success of MyHammer, Teichert went on to create several other notable companies in the fintech industry. In 2010, he co-founded the mobile payments platform, payleven, which was later acquired by the Swedish mobile payments company Zimpler in 2019. In 2012, he founded the mobile banking platform, Number 26, which later rebranded as N26. N26 has become one of the most successful digital banks in Europe, with over 5 million customers and a valuation of $3.5 billion. Teichert is also a co-founder and advisor to the fintech investment firm, Earlybird Venture Capital. Earlybird has invested in several early-stage fintech startups, such as Wefox, Tink, and Fraugster, among others. In addition to his entrepreneurial endeavors, Teichert is also an active investor and mentor to startups. He is known for his keen understanding of the fintech market, as well as his ability to identify innovative and disruptive startups. Teichert's contributions to the fintech industry have earned him numerous accolades, including being named one of the Top 50 Financial Technology CEOs by The Financial Technology Report in 2019. Overall, Thorsten Teichert is a notable figure in the fintech industry, with a proven track record of success in creating and scaling startups. His contributions have not only revolutionized the world of finance but have also made a significant impact on the global entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Alturas Municipal Airport is a public airport located in Modoc County, California, United States. The airport, which is operated by the County of Modoc, serves the city of Alturas and its surrounding areas. The airport covers an area of 400 acres and has one runway designated 11/29 with a length of 5,015 feet. The runway is made of Asphalt and is equipped with PAPI lights and LED runway edge lights, which enable safe landing and takeoff at night or low visibility conditions. The airport also has a small terminal building, a parking lot, and aviation fuel services available. Alturas Municipal Airport was first established in the 1940s, and it has since become an important hub for general aviation activities, including recreational flying, cargo operations, and medical transport missions. The airport is classified as a general aviation airport and handles up to 2,500 aircraft operations per year. Alturas Municipal Airport is known for its beautiful surroundings and its location near the Modoc National Forest, which attracts many visitors interested in outdoor recreational activities, such as hiking, camping, fishing, and hunting. The airport also serves as a gateway to the Modoc Plateau, a geologically unique area with stunning landscapes and diverse wildlife. The airport plays an important role in the economy of the region by facilitating business travel and trade with neighboring cities and states. Additionally, it provides emergency services and aviation support to local medical facilities, law enforcement agencies, and firefighting services. In conclusion, Alturas Municipal Airport is a vital asset to the community of Alturas and its surroundings. It provides safe and efficient air transportation services for passengers, goods, and emergency responders while promoting the economic development and natural beauty of the region.

Together Always is a phrase that is often associated with love and commitment. It is a vow shared amongst couples, friends, and family members to always remain in each other’s lives and support one another through thick and thin. This phrase has become a symbol of the unbreakable bond that can exist between two people. The phrase has been used in various literary works as well as popular culture. One of the most notable examples is the song “Together Always” by country singer Dolly Parton. The song talks about the beauty of spending time with loved ones and emphasizes the importance of cherishing those moments. Apart from popular culture, Together Always is also used in many formal and informal settings. For example, it is often included in wedding vows as a way of expressing the couple’s commitment to one another. It is also a common phrase used amongst close friends and family members to express their love and support. The concept of Together Always is deeply rooted in our human need for companionship and love. It highlights the idea that life is better lived when shared with others. Whether it’s a romantic partner, a best friend, or a sibling, having someone that you can rely on and share your ups and downs with is essential for a happy and fulfilling life. In conclusion, Together Always is a phrase that represents the strength and beauty of relationships. It reminds us that life is meant to be shared and that we are all better off when surrounded by people we love. It is a vow that serves as a reminder of the power of human connection and the importance of nurturing our relationships.

Raman Sreeraman is an Indian-American computer scientist known for his contributions in the fields of artificial intelligence and machine learning. Currently working as a Principal Scientist at Amazon, Sreeraman has made significant research contributions in the area of natural language processing. Early life and education: Raman Sreeraman was born in Chennai, India in the year 1974. He completed his Bachelor's degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering from the Madras Institute of Technology in 1995. Sreeraman moved to the United States in 1996 to pursue a Master's degree in Computer Science from the University of Maryland, College Park. After completing his Master's degree in 1998, Sreeraman worked as a Software Engineer at various companies including Intel Corporation and Oracle Corporation. Career: In 2005, Sreeraman joined Amazon as a Principal Scientist and has since been working in the area of natural language processing. He has contributed to the development of various machine learning models and algorithms pertaining to natural language understanding, dialog systems, and chatbots. In addition to his work at Amazon, Sreeraman has also been actively involved in the research community. He has published over 50 research papers in top-tier conferences and journals such as ACL, EMNLP, and ICML. Sreeraman has also served on the program committees of various conferences including ACL, NAACL, and COLING. Recognition: Sreeraman has received numerous awards and honors for his contributions in the field of natural language processing. In 2018, he was awarded the Amazon Science Award for his work on automatic summarization. Sreeraman has also been recognized as an ACM Distinguished Scientist for his contributions in the field of computer science. Personal life: Outside of his work, Sreeraman is an avid reader and enjoys reading books on history and philosophy. He lives with his family in Seattle, Washington.

Institutional dichotomy refers to the divide between formal and informal institutions, and their respective roles in society. Formal institutions are the legally sanctioned rules and organizations that structure and govern social life, such as governments, courts, and corporations. Informal institutions, on the other hand, are the unwritten rules and norms that govern social interaction, such as customs, traditions, and values. The existence of institutional dichotomy has important implications for the functioning of societies. In many cases, formal institutions and informal institutions may conflict with each other, leading to inefficiencies and delays in decision-making, as well as unequal access to power and resources. In addition, the distribution of power and resources among formal and informal institutions can also have significant consequences for social inequality. For example, if formal institutions are dominated by a narrow elite, and informal institutions are largely ignored, then certain groups may be excluded from critical decision-making processes that affect their lives. Overall, understanding the dynamics of institutional dichotomy is crucial for creating more inclusive and effective governance systems that promote social and economic development. By embracing both formal and informal institutions, and emphasizing their complementary roles, societies can ensure that all voices are heard and all individuals have the opportunity to participate in shaping their collective future.

Hridayakumari is an Indian film actress who primarily worked in the Malayalam film industry. She was born on January 31, 1949, in Thrissur, Kerala, India. She was known for her roles in movies such as "Apoorva Raagangal," "Kodiyettam," and "Oru Cheru Punchiri." Hridayakumari started her acting career in 1975 with the Malayalam movie "Apoorva Raagangal." She played the role of Sharada's sister in the movie, and her performance was highly appreciated. She went on to work in several movies and played various supporting roles in her career spanning over two decades. Some of her notable movies include "Kodiyettam," "Adhwaytham," "Oru Cheru Punchiri," "Ee Nadu," "Adiyozhukkukal," and "Moodupadam." Hridayakumari's performance in "Kodiyettam" was highly praised by critics, and it won her the Kerala State Film Award for Best Supporting Actress in 1978. Apart from acting, Hridayakumari was also a trained classical singer. She learned classical music from renowned musicians like K. Kalyanasundaram and T. V. Gopalakrishnan. She had sung in a few movies and had also released devotional albums. Hridayakumari was married to the late Malayalam actor, Santha Kumar, and the couple had two children. She passed away on July 12, 2009, due to cancer. Her death was mourned by the film industry, where she was remembered as a talented actress and a kind-hearted person. In conclusion, Hridayakumari was a versatile actress who had contributed to the Malayalam film industry with her talent and dedication. Her legacy lives on through her performances and the memories she left behind.

List of Disasters on the Severn The River Severn, situated in the United Kingdom, is the longest river in the country and has been the site of numerous natural and man-made disasters throughout history. 1. Floods: The Severn has experienced several devastating floods over the past centuries. The most notable flood occurred in 2007 when several towns along the river were flooded with water levels reaching up to 5 meters high. Other notable floods include the 1795 flood, 1947 flood, and 1960 flood. 2. Shipwrecks: The Severn Estuary has claimed several ships over the years. One of the most notable shipwrecks is that of the SS Norge, a British passenger liner that capsized after hitting a rock in 1904, leading to the loss of over 100 lives. 3. Industrial accidents: The river has been a site of several industrial accidents including the 1965 Aberfan disaster which involved the collapse of a colliery spoil tip and resulted in the loss of 144 lives. 4. Bridge collapses: In 1961, the Severn railway bridge collapsed into the river after a ship collided with one of its piers. There were no fatalities but damage was substantial. 5. Air crashes: The river has been the site of several air crashes including the 1957 Bristol Britannia crash that occurred near the Severn Bridge and led to the loss of 15 lives. 6. Disasters on the riverbanks: The riverbanks have been the site of several disasters including the 1985 Clifton Suspension Bridge Incident where a man fired a gun, leading to the death of three people and multiple injuries. In conclusion, the River Severn has been the site of several disasters throughout history. Floods, shipwrecks, industrial accidents, bridge collapses, air crashes, and disasters on the riverbanks have all occurred on the Severn. Despite these tragedies, the river remains an important part of the UK's landscape and continues to attract visitors from all over the world.

Alain Gautier is a French sailor who was born on December 18, 1962, in Les Sables-d'Olonne, Vendée, France. Gautier has been involved in sailing since childhood, and he began his professional sailing career at a young age. Over the years, Gautier has become a highly respected and accomplished sailor, and he has achieved numerous accolades in the world of sailing. Gautier is known for his success in ocean racing. In 1992, Gautier won the Vendée Globe, a single-handed round-the-world yacht race that is considered one of the most challenging sailing races in the world. Gautier's winning time of 110 days, 2 hours, and 22 minutes set a new record for the race, and he became the first sailor to complete the race in under 100 days. Following his victory in the Vendée Globe, Gautier went on to win other ocean racing events, including the Route du Rhum, the Transat Jacques Vabre, and the Solitaire du Figaro. Gautier's achievements in sailing have earned him numerous awards and honors. He was awarded the Prix de l'Académie des sports, an honor given to outstanding French athletes, in 1992. In 1993, he was awarded the Legion of Honor, the highest French order of merit. Gautier's accomplishments have also earned him recognition outside of France. In 1993, he was named World Sailor of the Year by the International Sailing Federation. In addition to his sailing career, Gautier has also worked as a coach and mentor to other sailors. He has coached young sailors in France and has served as a technical adviser to sailing teams around the world. Gautier was also a co-founder of the French Sailing Academy, an organization that provides training and support to young French sailors. Overall, Alain Gautier's sailing career has been marked by incredible achievements and contributions to the sport of sailing. His legacy as a sailor and mentor will continue to inspire young sailors for generations to come.

The Defiant Ones is a 1986 American crime drama film directed by David Lowell Rich and starring Robert Urich and Carl Weathers. The movie is a remake of the 1958 film of the same title directed by Stanley Kramer, which starred Tony Curtis and Sidney Poitier. The storyline of the movie revolves around the escape of two fugitives, one a white man and the other an African American, who are shackled together by chance. The film tells the story of con artist Billy Lyons (Robert Urich) and former boxer Ernie "Slam" Webster (Carl Weathers), who are both chained together while being transported to a maximum-security prison. After their transport crashes in the midst of a violent storm, they escape into the nearby woods. Over the course of their journey, the two men develop a bond and learn to work together despite their racial differences. The Defiant Ones explores themes of friendship, freedom, and racial tension in the American South. The film received positive critical reception for its performances, particularly those of Urich and Weathers. It was also praised for its cinematography, music score, and direction. The film was nominated for three Emmy Awards in 1987, including Outstanding Drama Special and Outstanding Sound Mixing. Robert Urich, who played the white fugitive Billy Lyons, was known for his roles in television series such as Vega$ and Spenser: For Hire. Carl Weathers, who played the African American fugitive Ernie "Slam" Webster, was best known for his role as boxer Apollo Creed in the Rocky film series. Overall, The Defiant Ones is considered a noteworthy film in the crime drama genre, highlighting the importance of unity and empathy despite differences in race, socioeconomic status, and personal beliefs. It continues to be regarded as a compelling piece of cinematic storytelling that provokes conversation and contemplation on the nature of human relationships and social justice.

William Smith (loyalist) was a prominent political figure in 18th century North America, known for his support of British colonial rule and opposition to the American Revolution. Born in New York in 1727, Smith became a successful lawyer and politician, serving as a member of the New York Assembly and later as the state's chief justice. However, his political views put him at odds with many of his fellow colonists. Smith strongly believed in the importance of maintaining British authority in the colonies, and opposed the idea of American independence. He argued that the colonists were better off under British rule, and that a break with the mother country would lead to chaos and instability. Smith was also a vocal critic of the radical elements within the Patriot movement, accusing them of promoting violence and anarchy. During the Revolutionary War, Smith became one of the most prominent Loyalists in New York. He worked closely with British officials, providing them with intelligence and helping to coordinate loyalist activities. In 1776, he was accused of treason by the Continental Congress and was forced to flee to England, where he spent the rest of his life. Despite his controversial views, Smith was highly respected within loyalist circles. He was known for his eloquence and his staunch defense of the British constitution. In his writings and speeches, he argued that the American Revolution was a threat to the rule of law and the principles of good government. His legacy as a defender of British colonialism continues to be debated by historians and political theorists. In conclusion, William Smith (loyalist) was a prominent political figure in 18th century North America who opposed the American Revolution and was a strong supporter of British colonial rule. Although his views were controversial and ultimately led to his exile, his staunch defense of the British constitution continues to be studied and debated by scholars today.

Château de Lourmarin is a stunning castle located in the charming village of Lourmarin, in the region of Provence, France. This castle is the largest and most impressive building in the village, and it holds a special place in the history of the local area. The construction of the Château de Lourmarin began in the 15th century, and it underwent several changes and additions over the centuries that followed. The castle was commissioned by Foulques d'Agoult, a French nobleman who resided in Lourmarin at the time. In the centuries that followed, the castle passed through the hands of several distinguished families before it was eventually purchased by Robert Laurent-Vibert in 1920. Today, the Château de Lourmarin is open to the public and it attracts thousands of visitors each year. The castle has been impeccably preserved, and its interiors are adorned with precious works of art, including paintings and sculptures from the 16th through the 19th centuries. Visitors can also admire the castle's magnificent Gothic and Renaissance architecture, with features such as a stunning square tower, an imposing entrance gate, and a beautiful chapel. The castle's gardens are another highlight of a visit to the Château de Lourmarin. They feature beautifully manicured lawns, colorful flowers, and several fountains and water features. The gardens also offer breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside, including the majestic Luberon mountain range. In addition to its cultural and historical significance, Château de Lourmarin is also an important venue for cultural events. The castle hosts several exhibitions, concerts, and performances throughout the year, making it a lively cultural hub for the local community. Overall, Château de Lourmarin is a must-visit for anyone traveling to Provence. With its rich history, stunning architecture, and impressive art collection, it is a true gem of the region and a testament to France's cultural heritage.

Alien Autopsy is a 2006 British comedy film directed by Jonny Campbell and written by William Davies and Simon Pegg. The movie is based on a real hoax that took place in 1995, where two Englishmen, Ray Santilli and Gary Shoefield, claimed to have obtained and released footage of an alien autopsy performed by the US military after a supposed crash in Roswell, New Mexico in 1947. The film stars Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly, also known as Ant and Dec, as Ray Santilli and Gary Shoefield, respectively. Other cast members include Bill Pullman, Harry Dean Stanton, and Götz Otto. The film was shot on location in London, Prague, and Sheffield. Alien Autopsy was released on April 7, 2006, and received mixed reviews from critics. The film grossed $8.7 million at the box office. Despite not being a commercial success, Alien Autopsy has since gained a cult following, especially in the UK. The film's plot revolves around Ray and Gary, two struggling British filmmakers who stumble across footage of an alien autopsy while trying to sell old reels of film. They decide to release the footage as a documentary, claiming it to be authentic, in the hopes of making a fortune. As they gain fame and fortune, they continue to perpetuate the hoax despite mounting evidence to the contrary. The film is presented as a mockumentary, blending real interviews with fictional reenactments of events. Alien Autopsy is a satirical look at the media's obsession with conspiracy theories and the lengths people will go to make a quick buck. The film's humor is often irreverent, poking fun at both the hoaxers and the believers. Despite its flaws, Alien Autopsy is an entertaining and enjoyable comedy that offers a fresh perspective on one of the most enduring mysteries of the modern era.

Johnny Hopp was an American professional baseball player who played as an outfielder in Major League Baseball (MLB) for thirteen seasons from 1939 to 1952. He played for the St. Louis Cardinals, the Pittsburgh Pirates, the Brooklyn Dodgers, and the Boston Braves. Hopp was born on July 18, 1916 in Hastings, Nebraska. He began his professional baseball career in the minor leagues in 1936, playing for the Class D Tucson Cowboys. He played for several minor league teams, including the Class A1 Columbus Red Birds, before being called up to the major leagues in 1939 to play for the St. Louis Cardinals. Hopp played for the Cardinals for seven seasons, from 1939 to 1945. He was a key player for the team during their successful run in the 1940s, including their World Series championship in 1942. In 1945, Hopp was traded to the Pittsburgh Pirates, where he played for two seasons. In 1948, Hopp was traded to the Brooklyn Dodgers, where he played for one season before being traded to the Boston Braves. Hopp played for the Braves from 1949 to 1952, and was part of their National League championship team in 1948. Over the course of his career, Hopp played in 1,355 games and had a batting average of .296. He had 1,548 hits, including 256 doubles, 64 triples, and 39 home runs. Hopp was known for his speed and his ability to hit for contact, and was a skilled outfielder. After retiring from baseball, Hopp worked as a scout for several MLB teams, including the Dodgers, the Braves, and the Houston Astros. He died on June 1, 2003 in Columbia, Missouri, at the age of 86. Hopp was inducted into the Nebraska Baseball Hall of Fame in 1966.

Hippeophyllum is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melastomataceae. It contains about 50 species of trees, shrubs and woody vines that are native to tropical regions of South America and the Caribbean. The genus was first described in 1858 by Augustin Pyramus de Candolle, a French-Swiss botanist, who named it after the Greek words "hippos" meaning horse and "phyllon" meaning leaf, in reference to the long, narrow leaves of some of its species. Most species in the genus have showy flowers that are pink, purple, or white in color. The flowers are borne in clusters or spikes and are often accompanied by colorful, fleshy fruits that are edible and used by humans and wildlife. Some species of Hippeophyllum are used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties, while others are cultivated as ornamental plants or used for reforestation and soil conservation. Hippeophyllum bipartitum, for example, is a popular ornamental plant in the horticultural industry due to its showy purple flowers and unique foliage. Its large leaves are deeply lobed and resemble horse hoof prints, hence its common name "Horse hoof Tree". Other notable species include Hippeophyllum hirsutissimum, which has medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine to treat fevers, and Hippeophyllum calophyllum, which is important for reforestation efforts in degraded areas of Brazil. Despite their ornamental and medicinal value, many species of Hippeophyllum are threatened by habitat loss, deforestation, and overexploitation. Conservation efforts are underway to protect and conserve these unique and valuable plant species.

Benyamin Bahadori is an Iranian pop singer, songwriter, and composer, best-known for his heart-touching ballads. He was born on April 2, 1985, in Tehran, Iran. He began playing the piano at the age of five and started singing in choirs at the age of ten. Despite his early passion for music, he did not pursue a music career until later in life. He graduated in civil engineering from Islamic Azad University. Bahadori started his music career in 2006, with the release of his debut album "85". From then on, he released several successful albums, including "94", "94-2", and "94-3". Notably, he has collaborated with some of the best producers and musicians in the Iranian music industry, including Babak Saeedi, Behzad Pax, Omid Jahan, and Siavash Ghomayshi. Bahadori's style of music can be described as a mix of pop and ballad, with an emotional touch. He writes his lyrics, and his themes revolve around love, heartbreak, and life experiences. Some of his famous songs include "Khatereha" (Memories), "Haftehaye Takht" (Weeks of the Crown), and "Man Emshab Mimiram" (I Will Die Tonight). Bahadori's music has garnered him a massive fan following, earning him several notable awards and nominations. In 2011, he won the Best Male Pop Singer award at the Iranian Music Popularity Awards. He also won the Best Song of the Year award in 2015 at the same event for his song "20". Outside his music career, Bahadori has been vocal about his support for Iranian sports, particularly soccer. He has appeared in several soccer-related events, and his songs have been used as official soundtracks for national soccer teams. In conclusion, Benyamin Bahadori's music has touched the hearts of many Iranians and has established him as one of the most popular pop singers in the country today. His passion and dedication to his craft have earned him accolades and a loyal fan base.

John Baumgartner (born 1976) is an American geophysicist who is currently a research scientist at the Los Alamos National Laboratory. He is best known for his work in computer simulations of geological processes, in particular in developing the software GPlates for the reconstruction of the Earth's surface and the simulation of plate tectonics. Baumgartner received his Ph.D. in geophysics from the University of California, Los Angeles in 2002, where he focused on investigating the formation and evolution of subduction zones. He later became a postdoctoral researcher at the California Institute of Technology where he worked on developing numerical models of tectonic plate motion and the interaction between continents and the oceanic lithosphere. In 2008, Baumgartner joined the Los Alamos National Laboratory, where he continued his research in plate tectonics and mantle dynamics. He is now a key member of the Earth and Environmental Sciences group at the laboratory, where he manages several projects related to the development of high-performance computing models of geological processes. Baumgartner's research has led to important advances in the field of geophysics, particularly in the area of computer simulations of tectonic plate motion. His work has been published in numerous high-profile scientific journals, such as Nature, Science, and Geology. In addition to his research, Baumgartner is also a dedicated educator and has taught numerous courses in geophysics and computational science at both the undergraduate and graduate levels. His work has received numerous awards and recognitions, including the National Science Foundation's CAREER award in 2006 and the Los Alamos National Laboratory's Distinguished Performance Award in 2012. Overall, John Baumgartner is a highly respected figure in the field of geophysics, whose research has contributed greatly to our understanding of the Earth's geological processes.

Debra Houry is an American physician and public health advocate who currently serves as the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's National Center for Injury Prevention and Control (NCIPC). She is best known for her work in addressing the nation's opioid epidemic, improving access to mental health care, and preventing violence in communities. Dr. Houry was born in New York and raised in South Florida. She received her medical degree from Emory University School of Medicine, where she also completed her residency in emergency medicine. Following her residency, she completed a fellowship in injury prevention at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. During her career, Dr. Houry has focused on using data-driven strategies to improve public health outcomes. She has led several initiatives addressing the opioid epidemic, including the development of CDC Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain. Additionally, she has worked to prevent firearm injuries through the development of the CDC National Violent Death Reporting System. In recognition of her contributions to public health, Dr. Houry has received numerous awards and honors from organizations such as the American College of Emergency Physicians, the Atlanta Business Chronicle, and the University of Michigan School of Public Health. Dr. Houry is a sought-after speaker and has authored numerous articles and book chapters on topics related to public health and injury prevention. She is also a respected educator, having served as a professor at Emory University School of Medicine and as a mentor to numerous public health professionals. Through her leadership at the NCIPC, Dr. Houry continues to work towards reducing preventable injuries and improving the health of individuals and communities across the United States.

Tsui Po-ko ( 鄒保激, 1936-2004) was a Hong Kong artist, educator, and collector. He is known for his paintings, calligraphy, and his role as a mentor to a generation of young artists. Early life and education: Tsui Po-ko was born in 1936 in Guangdong, China. He moved to Hong Kong in the early 1950s and enrolled in the Fine Arts department of the Hong Kong Chinese University. He was mentored there by renowned artists such as Lui Shou-kwan and Wucius Wong. Career: Tsui Po-ko started his career as an art teacher in various secondary schools in Hong Kong. He then became head of the Fine Arts Department at Yan Chai Hospital Lim Por Yen Secondary School. During his time there, he developed a teaching style that was innovative and helped his students develop their own artistic careers. Tsui Po-ko was an accomplished painter, and his works often reflected his own life experiences and cultural values. He was especially well-known for his calligraphy, which he was said to have learned from a Taoist monk during his youth in China. In addition to his artistic work, Tsui Po-ko was also a collector of Chinese art and antiques. He amassed a large collection, which he used to educate others about Chinese art and culture. He often lectured on art history and was a frequent guest curator at exhibitions and museums in Hong Kong and China. Legacy: Tsui Po-ko passed away in 2004 at the age of 68, but his legacy lives on through his art, teachings, and his collection. He remains an important figure in the Hong Kong art scene and was honored in 2013 with a retrospective exhibition at the Hong Kong Museum of Art. His works are held in public and private collections globally, including the Hong Kong Heritage Museum, the British Museum, and the National Art Museum of China.

LSU Indoor Practice Facility The LSU Indoor Practice Facility is a 83,000-square-foot multi-purpose athletic facility located in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. The facility was built in 2016 to provide a state-of-the-art indoor practice space for the Louisiana State University (LSU) Tigers football team. The facility cost approximately $28 million dollars to construct and provides a year-round practice area for the team. The LSU Indoor Practice Facility features a full-length football field as well as a 60-yard sprint track. The facility also includes an audiovisual system, climate control, and ample space for weightlifting and conditioning. In addition to serving as a practice space for the football team, the facility is also used by other LSU athletic programs including baseball, softball, and gymnastics. The LSU Indoor Practice Facility was designed to withstand the harsh Louisiana climate, including hurricanes and extreme heat. The facility has a steel frame and a fabric roof that allows for natural light while also protecting the athletes from the elements. The facility also includes several large fans and a cooling system to keep the athletes comfortable during hot Louisiana summers. The LSU Indoor Practice Facility was funded entirely through private donations, including a $15 million donation from alumnus Stephen C. and Sherrill Dupree’s family foundation. The rest of the funding was provided by various other donors, including former LSU football player and NFL quarterback, Peyton Manning. Since its construction, the LSU Indoor Practice Facility has been a valuable asset to the LSU athletics program, providing the football team and other athletic programs with a top-notch, year-round practice space. The facility has also helped attract top-notch athletes to LSU, as it provides athletes with a state-of-the-art practice space that is on par with other top-ranked athletic programs in the country.

The Bathurst Motor Festival is an annual event held at the famous Mount Panorama racing circuit in Bathurst, Australia. The festival attracts thousands of motorsport enthusiasts from around the country and overseas each year. The Bathurst Motor Festival is one of the biggest and most popular car racing events in Australia, featuring a wide range of motorsport competitions that cater to all types of race fans. The Bathurst Motor Festival was first staged in 2011 and has grown in popularity ever since. The festival usually takes place over the Easter long weekend in April and brings together a wide range of different types of racing cars, including production cars, sports cars, touring cars, and open-wheelers. The festival allows visitors to experience the thrill of racing, as well as see some of the latest and greatest cars on display. One of the main events of the Bathurst Motor Festival is the Production Car race, one of the most competitive events of its kind in the country. The race features a wide range of cars from different manufacturers, including BMW, Audi, and Porsche. The touring car races are also popular attractions, with the Super Sprint and Endurance races testing the drivers' skill and endurance on the legendary Mount Panorama circuit. Apart from the racing events, the Bathurst Motor Festival also offers a wide range of off-track activities, including a car show, merchandise stalls, food vendors, and entertainment. The festival provides a fun, family-friendly atmosphere that is perfect for motorsport enthusiasts of all ages. In summary, the Bathurst Motor Festival is an exciting event that attracts car enthusiasts from around the world. The festival offers a thrilling experience that combines the excitement of racing with the beauty of the Mount Panorama circuit. With its wide range of racing events, car displays, and off-track activities, the Bathurst Motor Festival is a must-visit event for anyone who loves cars and racing.

John Braithwaite is a leading author in the field of criminology, specializing in regulatory and restorative justice. Born in 1951 in Australia, Braithwaite earned his Bachelor of Arts degree from the Australian National University and his Ph.D. in sociology from the University of California, Berkeley. Braithwaite has held academic positions at several prestigious universities, including the Australian National University, the University of Melbourne, the Australian Graduate School of Policing, and the University of Warwick in the United Kingdom. He has also been a visiting professor at numerous universities around the world, including the University of Pennsylvania, the University of California, Los Angeles, and the University of Cambridge. Braithwaite's research has focused on the effectiveness of different approaches to criminal justice, particularly those based on regulation and restoration. He has argued for a more collaborative and communicative approach to justice, in which offenders are encouraged to take responsibility for their actions and make amends to their victims and communities. Braithwaite's work has also addressed issues related to white-collar crime, corporate regulation, and environmental law. As well as his academic work, Braithwaite has been involved in public policy and advocacy. He served as Chairman of the Australian Government's National Roundtable on Restorative Justice and has advised governments and organizations around the world on criminal justice and regulatory issues. In 2006, he was awarded the prestigious Stockholm Prize in Criminology for his contributions to the field. Braithwaite is the author of numerous books, including Crime, Shame, and Reintegration (1989), Restorative Justice and Responsive Regulation (2002), and Anomie and Violence: Non-truth and Reconciliation in Indonesian Peacebuilding (2014). His work has had a significant influence on the development of restorative justice and regulatory theory, and he remains an active and respected voice in the field of criminology today.

Sacro Cuore di Cristo Re is a Catholic church located in the Roman neighborhood of Balduina. In Italian, Sacro Cuore di Cristo Re translates to "Sacred Heart of Christ the King." The church was built in the 1930s and is known for its impressive art deco-style architecture. The church was designed by the architect Marcello Piacentini, who was a prominent figure in the fascist regime of Benito Mussolini. The church's construction was commissioned by Pope Pius XI as a symbol of the Catholic Church's opposition to the Italian fascist regime. The church's interior is richly decorated with marble, mosaics, and frescoes. The main fresco, located above the altar, depicts the Sacred Heart of Jesus surrounded by angels. The church has a pipe organ that was built by the famous Italian organ builder Fratelli Ruffatti. One of the unique features of the church is its bell tower, which stands at a height of 75 meters. Visitors can climb to the top of the tower for a stunning view of the city of Rome. Over the years, Sacro Cuore di Cristo Re has become a popular pilgrimage site for Catholics from around the world. The church is also a cultural hub in the neighborhood, hosting concerts, art exhibits, and other events throughout the year. In recent years, the church has undergone extensive renovations to ensure that it continues to serve the community for generations to come. Despite its historical roots, Sacro Cuore di Cristo Re remains relevant and vibrant, serving as a testament to the enduring power of faith and community.

Alexis Peterson is an American professional basketball player who currently plays as a guard for the Seattle Storm of the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA). She was born on June 20, 1995, in Columbus, Ohio. Peterson played college basketball at Syracuse University, where she was an All-American and the Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC) Player of the Year during the 2016-2017 season. During her college career, Peterson played in 134 games for the Syracuse Orange and averaged 13.5 points, 3.2 rebounds, and 4.8 assists per game. She was instrumental in leading the Orange to their first NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament Final Four appearance in 2016, where they were defeated by the University of Connecticut. In her senior year, she led the nation in total assists with 250 and was named the ACC Player of the Year. After college, Peterson was selected 15th overall in the 2017 WNBA draft by the Seattle Storm. She played for the Storm during the 2017 season but was waived before the start of the 2018 season. Peterson then played overseas in Israel and Turkey before being re-signed by the Storm in 2020. In her first game back with the Storm, she scored 12 points and had 4 rebounds in a win against the New York Liberty. Outside of basketball, Peterson is known for her efforts in promoting social justice and racial equality. She has been active in speaking out against police brutality and advocating for equal opportunities for people of color. In 2020, she joined the WNBA's Social Justice Council, which aims to fight systemic racism and promote social justice initiatives. In conclusion, Alexis Peterson is a talented basketball player and an advocate for social justice. Her contributions to the sport of basketball and her work off the court have made her a role model for young athletes all over the world.

The Migrants Rights Network is a UK-based organisation that campaigns for the protection of migrants' rights. It was founded in 2006 by a group of activists who were concerned about the increase in xenophobia and racism in the UK. The organisation works to promote the rights of migrants, refugees, and asylum seekers in the UK, and aims to challenge the negative stereotypes and misinformation that often surround these groups. It also provides support and advice to individuals and organisations working in the field of migration. The Migrants Rights Network has several key areas of focus, including campaigning for the right to family reunion for refugees and for an end to deportations and detention of migrants. The organisation also works to promote the rights of migrant workers, particularly those who are exploited through low pay or poor working conditions. In addition to its campaigns, the Migrants Rights Network also conducts research into the experiences of migrants in the UK and how they are impacted by government policies. This research helps to inform the organisation's advocacy work and ensures that policies are based on evidence rather than fear or prejudice. The Migrants Rights Network has gained a reputation as a leading voice on migration issues in the UK. It has been actively involved in debates around immigration policy, and its expertise is regularly sought by policymakers, journalists, and other organisations. Overall, the Migrants Rights Network is committed to ensuring that migrants are treated with dignity and respect, and that their rights are enshrined in law and protected by the government. Through its campaigns, research, and advocacy work, the organisation is making a significant contribution to the fight for migrant justice in the UK.

McCormick-Stillman Railroad Park is a 40-acre park located in Scottsdale, Arizona, dedicated to preserving the history of railroading in the Southwest. The park was originally established in 1968 when the McCormick family donated the land to the city, and it has since become one of the most popular attractions in the area. The centerpiece of the park is the Paradise & Pacific Railroad, a miniature railroad that offers rides around the park. The 5/12th scale train features a steam locomotive and several passenger cars, and is a popular attraction for both children and adults. The park also features a museum that showcases the history of railroading in Arizona, with exhibits on the railroad lines that once ran through the state, as well as antique locomotives and other railroad memorabilia. In addition to the railroad attractions, the park also offers picnic areas, a playground, and several other recreational facilities. The park is also a popular destination for special events, including concerts, festivals, and holiday celebrations. The park is named in honor of the McCormick family, who were early settlers in the Scottsdale area. The family's patriarch, Cyrus McCormick, was a successful inventor and businessman who is best known for inventing the mechanical reaper, a machine that revolutionized agriculture in the mid-19th century. The McCormick family has been active in the Scottsdale community for generations, and their contributions to the city have been recognized in numerous ways, including the establishment of the McCormick-Stillman Railroad Park. Overall, the McCormick-Stillman Railroad Park is a unique and fascinating destination that offers visitors the opportunity to learn about the history of the Southwest through the lens of railroading. Whether you're a train enthusiast or simply looking for a fun day out with the family, the park is sure to be a memorable experience.

The Pythagorean Method of Memorization is a mnemonic technique based on the ancient Greek mathematician Pythagoras’ philosophy and numerology. This method involves associating numbers with letters and using them to create words or phrases that represent specific information. In this technique, each letter of the alphabet is assigned a numerical value based on its position in the Greek or Latin alphabet, such as A = 1, B = 2, and so on. Using this system, words are assigned numerical values based on the sum of their letters' numerical values. For example, the word “cat” would be assigned the numerical value of 24 (3 + 1 + 20), while the word “dog” would be assigned the value of 26 (4 + 15 + 7). These numerical values are then used to associate words with specific information, such as dates, names, and important facts. The Pythagorean Method of Memorization is based on the idea that the human brain is naturally wired to remember words and images better than numbers or abstract information. By associating information with words and phrases, the brain can more easily recall the information later. This method can be used for a variety of purposes, including memorizing historical dates, foreign language vocabulary, or even entire speeches. The key is to create meaningful associations between the words and the information to be remembered. While there is no scientific evidence that the Pythagorean Method of Memorization is more effective than other mnemonic techniques, many people have found it to be a useful tool for improving their memory and recall skills. Overall, the Pythagorean Method of Memorization is a technique based on associating numbers with letters in order to create words or phrases that represent specific information. This method has been used for centuries and can be a useful tool for anyone looking to improve their memory and recall skills.

Humans of New York: The Series is an American television documentary series that debuted on Facebook Watch in 2017. Based on the popular photoblog of the same name, the show is produced by Brandon Stanton and directed by Cheryl Dunn. The series features intimate interviews with ordinary people from all walks of life in New York City, capturing the diversity and complexity of the human experience. Each episode follows several individuals as they share their personal stories, struggles, and triumphs. What sets Humans of New York apart is its focus on human connection and empathy. The show aims to bridge the gap between people of different backgrounds and foster greater understanding and compassion. Through the lens of Stanton’s camera, viewers gain a deeper appreciation for the depth and richness of human experience. Humans of New York: The Series has received widespread critical acclaim for its honest and moving portrayal of life in New York City. The show has been praised for its powerful storytelling, engaging cinematography, and its ability to evoke empathy and connection. The show has also garnered a dedicated following and has been hailed as a cultural phenomenon. It has been credited with bringing attention to important social issues, including poverty, homelessness, immigration, and mental health. Overall, Humans of New York: The Series has become an important voice in contemporary documentary filmmaking. Its inclusive and humanizing vision serves as a reminder that behind every face is a unique and complex story waiting to be shared.

The Hong Kong women's national rugby sevens team is a national rugby sevens team that represents Hong Kong in international women's rugby sevens competitions. The team is governed by the Hong Kong Rugby Union, which was established in 1952, and has been competing in international rugby sevens tournaments since 1997. The team's first major tournament appearance was at the 2002 Asian Games, where they won silver, losing to China in the final. They have since participated in the Asian Rugby Sevens Series and the World Rugby Women's Sevens Series. In 2014, the team won the Asia Rugby Women's Sevens Series and earned the right to compete in the World Rugby Women's Sevens Series. They have since competed in several World Series events, including the Hong Kong Sevens, where they have consistently ranked as one of the top Asian teams. One of the team's notable achievements was their performance at the 2018 Rugby World Cup Sevens in San Francisco, where they finished in ninth place, defeating Brazil and Ireland in the process. The team also won the Plate competition at the 2019 Sydney Sevens, defeating Scotland in the final. The team is led by head coach Iain Monaghan and has a squad of talented athletes, including captain Christine Gordon, speedster Melody Li Nim-yan, and versatile player Jessica Ho Wai-on. The team's success has helped to further develop women's rugby in Hong Kong and inspire future generations of female rugby players.

Malta in the Eurovision Song Contest 2005 Malta participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2005, held in Kiev, Ukraine. The Maltese entry was "Angel" performed by Chiara, who had previously represented Malta in 1998 and 2003, placing third on both occasions. Chiara had won the Maltese national selection competition, Malta Song for Europe, with the song composed by Belgian guitarist Marc Paelinck and lyrics by former Eurovision winner and Maltese songwriter Gerard James Borg. In Kiev, Chiara performed the ballad in a long white dress, accompanied by four backing vocalists. The performance focused on her vocals and emotional delivery, earning a standing ovation from the audience. Chiara's performance was widely praised by critics, with some comparing her to international divas Celine Dion and Whitney Houston. In the Eurovision final on May 21, 2005, Malta placed second with a score of 192 points, making it the best result for Malta at the time, only beaten by Greece's Helena Paparizou. Chiara's success in the contest helped increase the popularity of the Eurovision Song Contest in Malta, where it has since become a cultural event with thousands of Maltese viewers tuning in to watch the annual competition. Chiara went on to represent Malta again in 2009 with the song "What If We" and in 2019 with the song "Chameleon", which she co-wrote. In conclusion, Malta's participation in the Eurovision Song Contest 2005 was a significant milestone for the country, with Chiara's powerful performance bringing Malta its best result at the time. The song "Angel" has become one of the most popular Eurovision songs and remains a fan favorite in Malta and abroad.

Nicolette Robinson is an American actress, singer, and dancer known for her performances on Broadway and in television. She was born on April 18, 1988, in Los Angeles, California, to parents who were both in the entertainment industry. Robinson began performing at a young age, taking dance classes and performing in school plays. After graduating from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), Robinson moved to New York City to pursue her career in entertainment. She made her Broadway debut in the hit musical "Waitress" in 2018, taking over the lead role of Jenna Hunterson from Tony Award-winner Jessie Mueller. Robinson's performance was praised for its emotional depth and strong vocals, earning her critical acclaim and a growing fan base. Robinson has also appeared in several television shows, including "The Affair" and "Perfect Couples." She is best known for her role as Jane in the NBC comedy series "Zoey's Extraordinary Playlist." In the show, Robinson plays the best friend of the titular character Zoey, who suddenly gains the ability to hear people's innermost thoughts through song and dance. Offstage, Robinson is active in social causes, including advocating for mental health awareness and supporting various charities. She is also married to Tony Award-winning actor and musician Leslie Odom Jr., with whom she has a daughter. In 2020, Robinson co-founded the multimedia production company Hillman Grad Productions along with Odom Jr. and fellow actor and producer Erika L. Johnson. The company's mission is to support and elevate diverse voices in the entertainment industry. In summary, Nicolette Robinson is a talented actress and singer who has made a name for herself on Broadway and in television. Her performances are marked by emotional depth and impressive vocals, and she is also an advocate for social causes and diversity in the entertainment industry.

Area codes 714 and 657 are two telephone area codes in the North American Numbering Plan that are located in Orange County, California. Area code 714 was created in 1951 as one of California's original area codes, while area code 657 was introduced as an overlay in 2008. The cities covered by the area codes 714 and 657 include Anaheim, Fullerton, Orange, Santa Ana, Buena Park, Garden Grove, Huntington Beach, and Westminster. The area codes have a combined population of over three million people and are part of the Los Angeles metropolitan area. The code 714 has been a part of Orange County for many years, and has undergone several changes since its inception. Originally, it covered all of southern California but was truncated to the southern half of Los Angeles County, including Long Beach, in the 1950s. In 1957, it also lost a portion of northern San Diego County to area code 619. On the other hand, the area code 657 overlays on top of 714. It was introduced in 2008 to provide additional phone numbers for Orange County. The overlay method involves adding a new area code within an existing area code, rather than splitting the existing area into two separate pieces. This reduces the inconvenience to existing customers while still allowing for more phone numbers. Area codes 714 and 657 are managed by the California Public Utilities Commission in association with the North American Numbering Plan Administration. These organizations oversee the allocation and use of telephone numbers throughout North America. In conclusion, area codes 714 and 657 are important parts of Orange County's telecommunication system, and are an integral part of the region's development and growth.

Zhuluo County is located in the northwest of Yunnan Province, China, with an area of 3,057 square kilometers and a population of 141,474 as of 2020. It is a mountainous region with numerous rivers and streams, and the climate varies greatly due to the complex terrain. The county is known for its scenic beauty and ethnic diversity. History Zhuluo County has a long history and culture. It was originally inhabited by the Bai and Yi ethnic groups, and later the Han people migrated to the region. In the Ming and Qing dynasties, it was included in the territory of Jianchuan County. In 1961, Zhuluo County was established. Tourism Zhuluo County is rich in natural resources and scenic spots. The most famous attraction is Laojunshan National Park, which is located in the north of the county. It is a national 5A-level scenic spot and a Taoist holy land. Other famous scenic spots include Xishan Scenic Area, Guanyin Valley Scenic Area, and Shangri-La Village. Culture Zhuluo County is a multi-ethnic area, with Bai, Yi, Han, Lisu, and other ethnic groups living together. Each ethnic group has its own unique customs, festivals, and folk arts. The Bai ethnic group has the Three-course Tea ceremony, the Yi ethnic group has the Torch Festival, and the Lisu ethnic group has the Knife-Pole Festival. Economy Zhuluo County’s economy is dominated by agriculture, forestry, and animal husbandry, with tea, medicinal herbs, seafood, and livestock as the main agricultural products. In recent years, with the development of tourism, the local economy has also been booming. Transportation Zhuluo County is about 180 kilometers away from Kunming, the capital of Yunnan Province. The main transportation method is by highway. The county also has a small airport, but only a few flights are available.

Prison rape is a form of sexual violence that is experienced by inmates in correctional facilities. It is a serious human rights violation that has been a longstanding issue in many countries around the world. Inmates subjected to this form of abuse often suffer physical and psychological harm, and the effects can be long-lasting. Prison rape can be perpetrated by other inmates, as well as by staff members in correctional facilities. It is often used as a tool for domination and control, and it can be particularly difficult for vulnerable individuals who may lack support networks or may be unfamiliar with the dynamics of prison life. Men are at particularly high risk of being subjected to prison rape, as they make up the majority of the inmate populations in many countries. There are many factors that contribute to the prevalence of prison rape. These include overcrowding in correctional facilities, which can exacerbate tensions and create a volatile environment. Other factors, such as a lack of oversight and accountability, as well as a culture of fear and intimidation, can also contribute to the problem. Efforts to address prison rape have been ongoing for many years. Some countries have implemented reforms aimed at providing greater protection for inmates, such as increasing staff training and creating mechanisms for reporting incidents of abuse. Other initiatives have focused on reducing the number of inmates in correctional facilities, as overcrowding is often a key factor in the problem. Despite these efforts, prison rape remains a serious issue that needs to be addressed. It is a gross violation of human rights, and it has a profound impact on the lives of all those who are affected by it. As such, it is important that governments, civil society organizations, and the public continue to work together to find effective solutions to this ongoing problem.

Christine Sixteen is a song by the American rock band, Kiss, released on their 1977 album Love Gun. Written by lead vocalist and bassist, Gene Simmons, the song tells the story of an older man's infatuation with a sixteen-year-old girl. The song opens with a catchy guitar riff played by lead guitarist, Ace Frehley, before Simmons’ bass and vocals kick in, driving the melody. The lyrics describe the older man’s desire for the young girl, with Simmons singing lines such as "She's young and clean, a teenage dream" and "She's got me dizzy, she sees me through to the end". While some have criticized the song for its potentially predatory theme, others argue that it is simply a playful rock and roll tune. Despite the controversy, "Christine Sixteen" became one of Kiss's most popular songs, reaching number 25 on the Billboard Hot 100 and earning gold certification. The band regularly performed the song in their concerts throughout the late 70s and 80s. The song has been covered by various artists over the years, including Guns N' Roses and The Donnas. In later years, Simmons has expressed regret over some of the lyrics in the song. In a 2016 interview with Esquire, he acknowledged that the song may have come across as "misogynistic" and stated that he "wouldn't write that song today". However, he also defended the song's catchiness, arguing that "sometimes people are too literal-minded". Regardless of its reception, "Christine Sixteen" remains a notable part of Kiss's discography and an iconic song of the rock and roll genre.

Chakkar is a Pakistani comedy film directed by Yasir Nawaz, produced by Shazia Wajahat, and written by Yasir Nawaz and Wajahat Rauf. The film stars Danish Taimoor, Neelam Muneer, Yasir Nawaz, Adnan Shah Tipu, Javed Sheikh, and Jawed Hashmi. It was released on May 5, 2022. Plot The film revolves around three friends, Nasir (Danish Taimoor), Shehzad (Yasir Nawaz), and Farooq (Adnan Shah Tipu), who are trying to run a successful business but are failing. They decide to try their luck in the betting world but accidentally get involved with a gangster named Faisal (Javed Sheikh). Faisal asks them to place a bet on a cricket match and promises to give them a big commission if they win. However, things go wrong when they accidentally place a bet on the wrong team and end up owing Faisal a huge amount of money. Now, the three friends must come up with a plan to pay off their debt and save their lives. They decide to rob a bank, but their plan goes wrong when they accidentally end up robbing a fake money printing company. This leads to a chain of hilarious events with the trio getting into more and more trouble. Cast * Danish Taimoor as Nasir * Neelam Muneer as Maryam * Yasir Nawaz as Shehzad * Adnan Shah Tipu as Farooq * Javed Sheikh as Faisal, a gangster * Jawed Hashmi as Kamal Reception Chakkar received mixed to positive reviews from critics, with many praising the performances of Danish Taimoor and Yasir Nawaz. The film was also praised for its humor and comic timing. Box office As of May 10, 2022, Chakkar has grossed PKR 42 million at the box office and is expected to do well in the coming weeks. Soundtrack The film's soundtrack was composed by the popular Pakistani musician Sahir Ali Bagga. It features six songs, including "Chakkar Ho Gaya", "Jogi", and "Dilbara".

The Vien Rabbinical Dynasty is a prominent Jewish dynasty with roots in Poland. It is named after the small town of Vien, where the family originated. The founder of the dynasty was Rabbi Yitzhak Meir Alter (1799-1866), also known as the Chiddushei HaRim. He was a disciple of the Chozeh of Lublin, one of the leaders of the Chasidic movement. Rabbi Alter was known for his deep knowledge of the Torah and his extraordinary spiritual insights. He was also a prolific writer and many of his works have been published and studied by scholars and students of Torah around the world. After Rabbi Alter's death, his son Rabbi Chanoch Henoch Alter (1829-1888) succeeded him as the Rebbe of Vien. He was known for his kindness and his dedication to his congregation. He continued his father's legacy of studying and teaching Torah, and also founded a number of institutions to help the poor and needy. Rabbi Chanoch Henoch's son, Rabbi Yehuda Aryeh Leib Alter (1847-1905), continued the family tradition of Torah study and leadership. He was also a prolific author and wrote many books on Jewish law, customs, and ethics. The Vien dynasty continued to flourish in the years that followed, with many of Rabbi Yehuda Aryeh Leib's descendants becoming prominent rabbis and scholars. They spread the teachings of their forefathers throughout the Jewish world, and many communities still look to the Vien dynasty for guidance and inspiration. Today, the Vien dynasty has branches in Israel, the United States, and other countries. Its members continue to dedicate themselves to the study and teaching of Torah, and to the welfare of the Jewish people.

Frans Sisita (born October 19th, 1989) is an Indonesian professional footballer who currently plays as a midfielder for Persipura Jayapura in the Liga 1 Indonesia. He is known for his versatility in playing various positions on the field and his exceptional technical abilities. Sisita started his career in football playing for youth academies in his hometown of Jayapura before joining the Persipura Jayapura youth academy at the age of 15. He progressed through the ranks and made his professional debut for the club in 2008, at the age of 19. Sisita quickly established himself as a key player for Persipura Jayapura and helped the club win the Liga Indonesia Premier Division title in 2010-2011. He continued to impress with his performances and was named the best young player in the Liga 1 Indonesia for the 2011-2012 season. Sisita's performances caught the attention of several other clubs in Indonesia, and he went on to play for Persija Jakarta, Arema FC, and PSM Makassar before returning to Persipura Jayapura in 2018. He helped the club finish as runners-up in the Liga 1 Indonesia in the 2018 season. Sisita has also represented the Indonesian national team, making his debut in 2014. He has since earned 17 caps for his country, scoring two goals. Off the field, Sisita is known for his charitable work, particularly in supporting children's education in his hometown of Jayapura. He also runs a football academy for young players in the region, hoping to inspire and nurture the next generation of football talents in Indonesia. Overall, Frans Sisita is a talented footballer who has made a significant contribution to Indonesian football. He continues to be an important player for Persipura Jayapura and is regarded as one of the best midfielders in the Liga 1 Indonesia.

Carl Froch vs. George Groves II was a highly anticipated rematch between British boxers Carl Froch and George Groves, which took place on May 31, 2014, at Wembley Stadium in London, England. The fight was for Froch's WBA and IBF super-middleweight titles. The first fight between the two took place on November 23, 2013, in Manchester, where Froch won by a controversial ninth-round knockout. Groves had dominated most of the fight, but the referee stopped the fight when Froch landed a barrage of punches that left Groves dazed on the ropes. Many felt that the stoppage was premature and controversial. The buildup to the rematch was intense, with both fighters engaging in heated exchanges in the media. Groves was confident of his chances and believed that he had the skills to defeat Froch, while Froch was determined to prove that the first fight was no fluke and that he was still the superior fighter. The fight itself was a sellout, with over 80,000 fans in attendance, making it the largest post-war attendance for a boxing match in the UK. From the opening bell, it was clear that both fighters had come to fight, and the intensity was palpable. In the eighth round, Froch landed a devastating right hand that knocked Groves out cold, ending the fight and retaining his titles. The stoppage was deemed fair by most, with Groves unable to continue after the debilitating punch. The rematch was considered a classic, with both fighters giving their all. The outcome solidified Froch's legacy as one of the greatest British boxers of all time, while Groves went on to win the WBA international super-middleweight title in later fights. Overall, Carl Froch vs. George Groves II was a momentous occasion in British boxing history and will be remembered for years to come.

Gender Equality and Family Development Select Committee The Gender Equality and Family Development Select Committee is a committee within the Parliament of the United Kingdom that is responsible for the examination of issues related to gender equality and family development. The committee is made up of Members of Parliament from various political parties and its primary objective is to promote and advance gender equality by scrutinizing government policies and initiatives that impact on women, families, and children. The committee was established in 2017, following increasing concerns about the need to address gender inequalities in various areas of society, including employment, education, health, and social protection. It was also recognized that family development was crucial to achieving gender equality and women's empowerment. The committee's key responsibilities include monitoring the government's progress in achieving gender equality and advancing family-friendly policies. It also conducts inquiries into specific gender-related issues and produces reports that contain recommendations for the government to consider. Some of the areas that the committee has focused on include maternity and paternity rights, child support, domestic violence, and gender pay gap. In addition to its statutory functions, the committee also engages in public outreach and consultation with various stakeholders, including civil society organizations, academics, and experts in the field of gender equality and family development. The committee also hosts public hearings and roundtable discussions to engage the public in the committee's work and to gather their views and recommendations on key issues. The Gender Equality and Family Development Select Committee has been instrumental in highlighting the need for gender equality in the UK and in promoting policies that support families. Its work has helped ensure that gender equality remains a priority for the government and has contributed to the development of policies and programs that ensure that women, families, and children are protected and empowered in all aspects of life.

Nevadaplano is a region located in western North America, covering the Great Basin in Nevada and parts of eastern California. The region is characterized by low, flat plains interrupted by mountain ranges and valleys. The term "plano" comes from the Spanish word for flat, reflecting the region's relatively level topography. The Nevadaplano is a high desert region with a semi-arid climate, characterized by hot summers and cold winters. The region receives low levels of precipitation, resulting in sparse vegetation and dry landscapes. Despite these conditions, the region is home to a variety of species adapted to desert environments, including pronghorn antelope, desert tortoise, and the sage grouse. The region is also home to several protected areas including Great Basin National Park and Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area. Many indigenous tribes have inhabited the Nevadaplano region for thousands of years, including the Paiute, Shoshone, and Washoe. European exploration of the region began in the 18th century, with Spanish explorers mapping the area and establishing trade routes. In the 19th century, the discovery of silver and gold in the region led to a mining boom, with towns like Virginia City and Tonopah springing up. The region also played a role in the westward expansion of the United States, with the Pony Express and Transcontinental Railroad passing through the area. Today, the Nevadaplano region is an important center for mining, agriculture, and tourism, with Las Vegas serving as a hub for the region's economy. The region is also home to several universities and research centers focused on the environment, including the Desert Research Institute and the Great Basin Center for Geothermal Energy. Despite its arid conditions, the Nevadaplano remains an important center for scientific research and exploration, with many mysteries still waiting to be uncovered in this vast expanse of desert land.

Monis Rahman is a Pakistani entrepreneur and the founder of Rozee.pk, the country's leading job portal. He was born on March 14, 1976, in Lahore, Pakistan. After completing his education, Rahman worked in the field of software engineering before starting his own company. In 2007, Rahman founded Rozee.pk, which has become the go-to platform for job seekers and employers in Pakistan. The website features job postings from various sectors, ranging from finance to technology to healthcare. It has also expanded its services to provide employer branding solutions and career counseling services. Under Rahman's leadership, Rozee.pk has become one of the most successful startups in Pakistan. The company has received numerous awards, including the Asia/Pacific Stevie Award for Most Innovative Company in 2016 and the Best Employer Branding Strategy Award at the Pakistan Digi Awards in 2021. Aside from his work with Rozee.pk, Rahman is also involved in various philanthropic endeavors. He established the "Rozee Foundation" in 2008, which provides scholarships to deserving students and supports other social welfare initiatives. In recognition of his contributions to Pakistan's tech and entrepreneurial scene, Rahman has been invited to speak at various conferences and events. He has also served as a mentor to other startups and has been featured in numerous local and international publications. In 2014, Rahman was named on the Forbes 30 under 30 Asia list, which recognizes young entrepreneurs who are making an impact in their respective fields. He continues to lead Rozee.pk towards new heights while also giving back to his community through his philanthropic work.

Improv Asylum is a renowned improvisational comedy theater located in Boston, Massachusetts. It was founded in 1998 by Chet Harding and Norm Laviolette, two seasoned improvisational actors and business partners. The theater offers a variety of comedic shows and classes, attracting audiences from across the country. The theater's name, Improv Asylum, pays homage to the location where it was first established - in the basement of the historic Charles Playhouse. The theater has since moved to its current location at 307 Congress Street in the city's Fort Point neighborhood. Improv Asylum's performances include a mix of both improv and sketch comedy, with a particular emphasis on topical and political humor. The theater's flagship show, "The Main Stage," is performed by a talented ensemble of actors who create scenes and stories on the spot based on audience suggestions. Other popular shows include "All the Single Ladies," a musical parody of Beyonce's hit song, and "Charles River," a satire of Boston culture and politics. Improv Asylum has also gained recognition for its specialized corporate training programs. The theater's business-oriented improv training sessions aim to help companies develop better communication skills, team building, and creative problem solving. In its more than two decades of existence, Improv Asylum has been recognized with numerous awards, including the 2017 Improv Theatre of the Year by the Best of Boston awards. It has also been featured on several television shows, including Comedy Central's "Premium Blend" and "Last Comic Standing." Improv Asylum's commitment to diversity and inclusion has led to the establishment of its diversity scholarship program. The program provides financial assistance to talented performers from underrepresented communities who wish to enroll in the theater's improv training programs. In short, Improv Asylum has left its mark as one of Boston's most iconic entertainment venues. With its emphasis on improvisation and boundary-pushing humor, it has solidified its place as a beloved institution in the world of comedy.

Sempronius Densus was a prominent Roman politician and military figure who lived during the Republican era. He was born in the late 3rd century BCE and belonged to the plebeian gens Sempronia. Densus served as a consul twice and held several other important positions in the Roman government and military during his career. Densus's first consulship was in 254 BCE, during the First Punic War against Carthage. He and his colleague, Lucius Caecilius Metellus, were tasked with mobilizing troops and coordinating the war effort against the Carthaginians. Densus played a key role in the Roman victory at Panormus (modern-day Palermo) in Sicily, where he commanded the left wing of the Roman army. Densus's second consulship was in 252 BCE, during the same war. This time, he was paired with Marcus Servilius Structus. Densus distinguished himself again in battle, this time leading the Roman cavalry in the defeat of the Carthaginian general, Hasdrubal.
